title: johnmaster6
author: johnmaster6
content: Hello people, good afternoon, I need help.I lost access to my email that is on my blockchain.com account, so I accessed it using the 12 words, to create a new wallet and recover the balance, the first access worked perfectly, I left the browser window open for a few minutes , so the session expired, when I went to do the same step (access using the 12 words), now the site returns the following message: "Restoring account failed. Please Try again"I'm not finding anything related to this message on the internet, has anyone here gone through this? or can you help me somehow?I've been trying since yesterday, I've waited an interval of 12 hours to try again, and the problem continues. If anyone has anything to say I would be very grateful.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Maybe this procedure is limited to one attempt per 24 hours per IP address - or maybe you should clear the cookies/cache from your browser and try again. The good news is that you can recover your wallet with the help of a desktop wallet, and people use Electrum most often. What is important is that you download the Electrum file from the official website, and in order to be completely sure of its credibility, it would be good to do a verification as well.[Guide]How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum [Guide] Restoring your standard wallet from seed    QuoteNote: If the seed words are from another wallet, like the blockchain.info wallet, Bither or Mycelium, then you have to press options and check bip39.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: johnmaster6 on March 14, 2023, 02:40:27 PMI lost access to my email that is on my blockchain.com account, so I accessed it using the 12 wordsIf you have seed, you can import it to Electrum wallet that is non custodial and you won't have to rely on Blockchain.com to recover your wallet.[Guide] Use CPFP if your stucked transactions from blockchain.com wallet. Read a part for import seeds from Blockchain.com to Electrum wallet.If you are careful, let's spend time to read topics shared by Lucius, to verify your download.

comments.author: johnmaster6
comments.body: Good morning, thanks for the tips, after a lot of trying, today I got it! I was using VPN to tell me, so I used Cellular Internet 4g, and everything worked. I took the opportunity to migrate the BTC to my Trezor Hardware Wallet, now I'm safe! Thanks again for the tips

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: johnmaster6 on March 16, 2023, 10:42:13 AMI took the opportunity to migrate the BTC to my Trezor Hardware Wallet, now I'm safe!Make sure you already made a backup of your Trezor Hardware wallet with recovery seed. How to use a recovery seed for your TrezorIf you want to have a mini amount of BTC to use when you hang out, you can consider to use Electrum wallet on your mobile devices as your hot wallet. Basically with hot wallet, don't store big amount of your coin in it.

comments.author: JamesBorn
comments.body: Some devices hardly support hardwares sites, check you're browser is well accessible too because at times it failed because of network of update of your system. It has happens to me before, several attempts can also cause it. Don't try it often
